Getting started

Source: vignettes/reschola.Rmd
reschola.Rmd

This document describes the basics of working with this package and provides signposting to more detailed documentation of setup and workflow used at Schola Empirica.

The most important components include:

Guidance on how to set up your computer and your mind for doing data analysis the Schola way

See the Setup [TODO] vignette (vignette('setup', package = 'reschola')).

An Rstudio project template for easy project setup

This is accessed through the RStudion menu: File > New project > New directory > Standard Schola Empirica Project.

See the Workflow [TODO] vignette for how to make the best use of the template in the context of the Schola Empirica workflow. (vignette('workflow', package = 'reschola')).

Templates for producing reports in the Schola style

Accesed through the RStudio menu: File > New File > R Markdown > From Template > [scroll down to reschola package], or through draft_* functions in the reschola package.

Notably, there is a templated based on redoc a package enabling collaboration between Rmarkdown and MS Word. See the Workflow [TODO] vignette (vignette('workflow', package = 'reschola')) for details.

A ggplot2 theme in the Schola style and related plotting utilities

See Making charts [TODO] vignette (vignette('charts', package = 'reschola')) for details.

Meta: keeping this packate up to date and up to scratch

This package should be a living, evolving tool and a set of living documents. See the See Developing this pacakge further [TODO] vignette (vignette('meta', package = 'reschola')) to understand how this package is being developed and thus how it can be extended and updated.

You can get a list of these vignettes in R by entering browseVignettes('reschola') and view them locally if you wish

Developed by Petr Bouchal, Schola Empirica.

Site built with pkgdown 1.4.1.
